segments.text: I see the woman standing at the sink, completely focused on that plate in her hands.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her dress and apron make her look so domestic, like she's in her own little world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But then I notice the water overflowing from the sink, creating a puddle at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can she not see it? The floor is going to be a slippery mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sunlight streaming through the window makes everything look so bright and cheerful outside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can hear the faint sound of laughter from the children, and it tugs at my heart.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But there’s something dangerous about what they’re doing near the cabinets.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is reaching into that cookie jar, balancing on that rickety stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but think how easily he could fall, and it would all be so avoidable.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is waiting like an eager little bird, her hand outstretched for a cookie.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: There’s a sweetness in their scheme, but it’s so reckless at the same time.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I want to shout, to warn them both, but I can’t move my feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel this pull between the joy of their laughter and the worry in my gut.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: If only the woman would look up from that dish, maybe she could prevent a disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The contrast of their innocent mischief and the looming chaos makes my heart race.
segments.speaker: PAR
